title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
02:53 <rrodriguez> has quit  
03:01 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
06:07 <DrLou> has quit  
07:16 <jvelociter> has quit  
08:10 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:14 <vmassol> has quit  
08:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <lucaa> has quit  
09:35 <+mflorea> cjdelisle: shouldn't XWIKI-6811 be closed?  
09:37 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <@cjdelisle> yes, thankyou for pointing that out, I am bad about that.  
09:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <vmassol> good morning  
09:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: welcome back, hope you had some good holidays ;)  
09:52 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I had cool holidays, now back in the hot summer of Lyon :)  
10:01 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <vmassol> mflorea: thanks for your help in the tests. As you can see several committers never care about functional tests unfortunately… leaving it to others to fix the tests… :(  
10:04 <vmassol> (it happens all the time)  
10:05 <+mflorea> indeed..  
10:06 <vmassol> note that I've asked sergiu to look at the functional tests after his week end commits but he hasn't done so....  
10:07 <vmassol> maybe we should implement "unbreakable builds"  
10:08 <vmassol> in short: you commit to a staging SCM, the build runs on your commit and only if it succeeds then it's pushed to the master repo, otherwise it's discarded  
10:09 <+mflorea> could work, but we need many CI agents  
10:09 <vmassol> not more than now  
10:09 <vmassol> this is what's happening now already  
10:10 <vmassol> except there's no staging and push/discard  
10:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: hmm I'm trying to edit https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/fb701a4caf9dcfc77415d19756627c93b246c774/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/api/XWiki.java in the github UI but the "edit this file" button doesn't work for me. Does it work for you?  
10:11 <+tmortagne> let me see  
10:11 <+mflorea> there is also the flickering tests problem. a commit might be discarded without a good reason  
10:11 <+tmortagne> sometime I don't have it but don't know why  
10:11 <+mflorea> although it will make the dev fix the flickering test to make his commit go to the master  
10:11 <vmassol> mflorea: a flickering is good reason to discard  
10:12 <+tmortagne> vmassol: same for me, I already had this issue, looks like a bug (github does not see you are logged at the level of the button it seems)  
10:12 <vmassol> yep  
10:12 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I think I found  
10:13 <+tmortagne> checkinf  
10:13 <+tmortagne> vmassol: make sure you are on master branch and it should be ok  
10:13 <+tmortagne> I was nowhere it seems  
10:13 <+tmortagne> with your link  
10:13 <+tmortagne> probably the same thing for you  
10:15 <vmassol> ok  
10:15 <vmassol> I've use my IDE in the end ;)  
10:15 <vmassol> \*used  
10:21 <vmassol> has quit  
10:21 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <vmassol> mflorea: have you answered the roadmap mail for 3.2 btw? I don't see it in my mailbox  
10:43 <vmassol> basically I'd like to know about the status for "App Within Minutes". We can talk offline (I've pinged you on  skype)  
10:49 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'll reply right now, sorry  
11:08 <vmassol> guys we have lots of bulds failing on ci  
11:08 <fmancinelli> has quit  
11:08 <vmassol> some setup it seems  
11:08 <vmassol> can someone help?  
11:08 <vmassol> I'm working on fixing UserProfileTest ATM  
11:10 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'll handling it  
11:10 <+mflorea> it's about rich text area  
11:10 <vmassol> UserProfileTest?  
11:10 <+mflorea> yes  
11:10 <vmassol> ok I'm leaving it to you then  
11:10 <+mflorea> thanks  
11:10 <vmassol> I'll take http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/109/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.xe/DocumentIndexAttachmentsTabFilterTest/testAttachmentsPane/  
11:12 <vmassol> who's taking http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/109/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.watchlist/WatchThisPageAndWholeSpaceTest/testWatchThisPageAndWholeSpace/ ?  
11:12 <+mflorea> ok, the watchlist test should have been fixed, maybe it did not use the latest oldcore jar  
11:12 <vmassol> the watchlist test is this one: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/109/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.watchlist/WatchThisPageAndWholeSpaceTest/testWatchThisPageAndWholeSpace/ ?  
11:12 <+mflorea> yes  
11:12 <vmassol> ok  
11:12 <vmassol> cool  
11:12 <vmassol> so only 2 tests to fix  
11:12 <+mflorea> yes, in ui tests  
11:13 <+mflorea> but I see the selenium 1 tests don't run, because of FF6 I suppose  
11:13 <vmassol> now someone needs to helpt o stabilize the agents  
11:13 <vmassol> oh…. hmm didn't realize this  
11:13 <+mflorea> I'll take a look at the wysiwyg tests, see how we can make them run on FF65  
11:13 <vmassol> we have 2 solutions  
11:13 <vmassol> one solution is to leave FF 3.x on one agent  
11:13 <+tmortagne> yes just seen there is browser issue with LDAP test  
11:13 <vmassol> and bind sel1 tests to it  
11:14 <vmassol> another one is to move tests to sel2....  
11:14 <+tmortagne> converting LDAP test to sel2 should not be too much work, looking at it currently  
11:16 <+mflorea> converting wysiwyg tests is not that easy, it will take some time, so solution 1 is the only option for now, unless we can make selenium 1 run on FF6, I'll search a bit for a solution.  
11:17 <+tmortagne> vmassol: do we already have any project using selenium2 other that test-ui ?  
11:18 <+tmortagne> to see an example of how to use test-ui framework from another project  
11:18 <vmassol> tmortagne: no, only tests-ui  
11:18 <+tmortagne> (should probably be moved)  
11:18 <vmassol> mflorea: ok let us know what you find and then we can decide what we do  
11:18 <+mflorea> sure  
11:19 <vmassol> tmortagne: +1 to move  
11:21 <+tmortagne> I think I will wait for tomorrow for that since it's the right day for it ;)  
11:21 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok…. could you look at binding the sel1 tests to an agent using FF 3.x?  
11:22 <+tmortagne> was talking about the move not the convert, right now I will see how to quickly directly reuse test-ui  
11:22 <vmassol> ah ok  
11:23 <+tmortagne> we have an agent still on FF 3 ?  
11:23 <vmassol> no  
11:23 <+tmortagne> ok  
11:23 <vmassol> but FF 3.x is still there on all machines  
11:23 <vmassol> actually  
11:23 <+tmortagne> I can maybe start with that at least  
11:23 <vmassol> we might want in the future to have different browsers/versions installed on different agents  
11:23 <vmassol> in order to test different combinations  
11:23 <+tmortagne> yep but there is not much reason to test old FF version  
11:24 <+tmortagne> but other browsers yes  
11:24 <vmassol> well first we need to define our browser version strategy  
11:24 <vmassol> (discussion of yesterday)  
11:24 <vmassol> (sburjan` is handling it and will make a proposal)  
11:24 <+tmortagne> here the issue is not related to XWiki  
11:25 <+tmortagne> ok lets go back to FF3 on lets say agent4  
11:25 <+tmortagne> ok with you ?  
11:26 <vmassol> ok…. might be good to change the agent name in jenkins to reflect the browser on that agetn  
11:26 <+tmortagne> i'm putting a label  
11:26 <vmassol> something like agent1 (FF6), agent4 (FF3.x)  
11:26 <vmassol> yes but I mean when we'll look at build failures we'll need to remmeber that information  
11:27 <+tmortagne> sure but you can see the version of FF in the log  
11:27 <+tmortagne> at the begining  
11:27 <vmassol> (was just an idea to make it easy and not have to navigate to agent definition page)  
11:27 <vmassol> ah ok  
11:27 <+tmortagne> I think  
11:27 <+tmortagne> checking  
11:28 <+tmortagne> hmm actually not sure  
11:28 <vmassol> still might be good to have a global overview of our agents  
11:28 <vmassol> agent1-N isn't very descriptive  
11:28 <vmassol> :)  
11:28 <+tmortagne> I togh the path was displayed  
11:28 <+tmortagne> tough  
11:28 <vmassol> it's ok when they're all similar but starts to fall short when they're not  
11:29 <+tmortagne> maybe there is a jenkins plugin to automatically add labels after the names of the agent  
11:29 <vmassol> maybe  
11:29 <+tmortagne> ok even just a setup  
11:29 <+tmortagne> checking  
11:41 <+tmortagne> agent-4 moved to FF3, tying selenium1 based project on it  
11:48 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
11:49 <vmassol> seems to be working  
12:12 <+tmortagne> vmassol: souldn't we remove xwiki-enterprise-tests job ?  
12:13 <vmassol> yes you can remove it now  
12:13 <vmassol> I had left it since I was testing but I forgot to remove it  
12:15 <+tmortagne> done  
12:16 <vmassol> thanks

13:40 <flavius\_> http://pastebin.com/JHWuyHrY  
13:41 <flavius\_> cjdelisle: can you give me some hints?  
13:44 <mflorea> has quit  
13:45 <flavius\_> cjdelisle: on filesystem it created a folder instead of an file

14:43 <vmassol> mflorea: you're on testWatchThisPageAndWholeSpace?  
14:43 <vmassol> (I got it failing locally too)  
14:44 <+mflorea> do you have the latest oldcore jar?  
14:44 <vmassol> ah no :)  
14:44 <+mflorea> I'll try myself locally, but I'm pretty sure I fixed it  
14:44 <vmassol> you must have fixed it  
14:44 <vmassol> are you on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/114/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.administration/UserProfileTest/testEditProfile/ ?  
14:45 <+mflorea> yes  
14:45 <vmassol> (it's the last one failing on ci)  
14:45 <vmassol> ok  
14:45 <cjdelisle> has quit  
14:47 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:09 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:15 <+tmortagne> it's weird agent1 is available but there is test waiting for I don't know what that could run on it  
15:17 <vmassol> tmortagne: yes noticed that tests don't run on agent1 but I'm not sure why  
15:17 <vmassol> (haven't invesitaged either)  
15:17 <+tmortagne> well they were running on it 1h ago  
15:18 <+tmortagne> it's like the queue was stuck because xwiki-repository-tests is tie to another agent than agent1 which would make jenkins a bit dumb  
15:19 <+tmortagne> just fixed xwiki-repository-tests  
15:19 <+tmortagne> will see  
15:19 <+tmortagne> ok still stuck  
15:34 <vmassol> I'm on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/116/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.administration/RegisterFromAdministrationTest/testRegisterJohnSmith/  
15:42 <vmassol> "Selenium 2.5.0 has landed safely in maven central" — going to test locally….  
15:55 <vmassol> nice…. http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/7596/console  
15:55 <vmassol> this happens quite frequently....  
15:55 <vmassol> (I've seen it at least 4-5 times)  
15:55 <vmassol> jvm crash  
15:56 <vmassol> 1.6.0.26 is the latest jvm though....  
15:57 <+tmortagne> vmassol: maybe it's always on agent-4  
15:57 <vmassol> yes that's possible  
16:47 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think some admins on jira have created wrong components for xwiki platform project  
16:47 <vmassol> I see for example: HTML Export or PDF Export  
16:47 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yep I seen you mail  
16:47 <vmassol> ah right I sent a mail  
16:47 <vmassol> (had forgotten)  
16:48 <vmassol> since they don't want to tell us who they are  
16:48 <+tmortagne> but i'm not sure it's really a mistake, I think at some point we started to create component for oldcore ccomponents  
16:48 <vmassol> I propose to remove them  
16:48 <vmassol> I don't remember that  
16:49 <+tmortagne> because theses "should" be separated modules  
16:49 <vmassol> I'm pretty sure we followed the convention of one module = one component  
16:49 <vmassol> hmmm  
16:49 <+tmortagne> but i'm not sure  
16:49 <vmassol> actually you're putting doubts in my mind now  
16:49 <vmassol> :)  
16:49 <+tmortagne> at first we  did not had oldcore at all in fact  
16:49 <+tmortagne> from what I remember  
16:49 <+tmortagne> we finally added it but I don't remember why  
16:50 <+tmortagne> mayeb for old stuff for which we could not find meningful components  
16:50 <vmassol> ok so we leave it like this, hoping that there'll be modules in the future for those or we remove them and put issues in oldcore  
16:50 <vmassol> ?  
16:51 <vmassol> logically we shouldn't create componnts for modules that don't exist yet  
16:51 <+tmortagne> I would say lets remove them for now, that's a too complex rule to follow  
16:51 <vmassol> yes I'm tempted by this too  
16:52 <+tmortagne> when some module will be added it will have its own component but until them it's actually make the thing pretty clear that there is too much stuff in oldcore soe lets improve it ;)  
16:53 <vmassol> yes that too  
16:53 <vmassol> :)  
17:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: can you log on skype?  
17:08 <+tmortagne> hmm it freezed again...
